fields.description:
This is a request to extend the DescribeVMTypes support in IAM to allow restrictions of which VM Types can be viewed by the user/group/account.

We lock down on VM Types that a user can use by creating an EIAM policy like this:

{code}
{
  "Statement": [
    {
        "Action": [
        "ec2:AllocateAddress",
        "ec2:AssociateAddress",
        "ec2:AttachVolume",
        "ec2:Authorize*",
        "ec2:CreateKeyPair",
        "ec2:CreateSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:CreateSnapshot",
        "ec2:CreateVolume",
        "ec2:DeleteKeyPair",
        "ec2:DeleteSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:DeleteSnapshot",
        "ec2:DeleteVolume",
        "ec2:DetachVolume",
        "ec2:Describe*",
        "ec2:DisassociateAddress",
        "ec2:GetConsoleOutput",
        "ec2:TerminateInstances",
        "ec2:ReleaseAddress",
        "ec2:RunInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Action": [
        "ec2:RunInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Deny",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.small",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.large"
    }
  ]
}
{code}

But we could still see all the VM Types inside user console if logged in as that user.

If we choose the VM Type m1.large or m1.small the instance would fail to get launched as expected due to the EIAM policy above but we would like to remove these instance types from the drop down list in the user console itself for certain users.

Looking at it more, it seems the User console makes a DescribeInstanceTypes API call to the CLC but there is no restriction to the call specified in the EIAM policy specification 

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/policy/PolicySpec.java
fields.summary: Extending DescribeVMTypes to Support Restricting Views of VM Types via IAM

comments.body:
[~hspencer] customer is asking the turnaround time for this , can you please let us know the same ?

Is it going to come in 3.3.1 or 3.4.0 or 4.0 ?

cc [~chuck]
[~shashi], Please review for the feature backlog in 3.4 time frame.
I assume one would use ec2:DescribeInstanceTypes" for the Action instead?

Added support for non-standard DescribeInstanceTypes EC2 action which can be used to restrict instance types as follows:

{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a sjones
sjones	123137003518
# euare-usercreate --as-account -u sjones
# euare-useruploadpolicy --as-account sjones -u sjones -p test -o '{
  "Statement": [
    {
        "Action": [
        "ec2:AllocateAddress",
        "ec2:AssociateAddress",
        "ec2:AttachVolume",
        "ec2:Authorize*",
        "ec2:CreateKeyPair",
        "ec2:CreateSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:CreateSnapshot",
        "ec2:CreateVolume",
        "ec2:DeleteKeyPair",
        "ec2:DeleteSecurityGroup",
        "ec2:DeleteSnapshot",
        "ec2:DeleteVolume",
        "ec2:DetachVolume",
        "ec2:Describe*",
        "ec2:DisassociateAddress",
        "ec2:GetConsoleOutput",
        "ec2:TerminateInstances",
        "ec2:ReleaseAddress",
        "ec2:RunInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Allow",
      "Resource": "*"
    },
    {
      "Action": [
        "ec2:DescribeInstanceTypes"
      ],
      "Effect": "Deny",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/c1.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m3.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.2xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m3.2xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cc1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/hi1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cc2.8xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cg1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cr1.8xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/hs1.8xlarge"
    },
    {
      "Action": [
        "ec2:RunInstances"
      ],
      "Effect": "Deny",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/c1.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m3.xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.2xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m3.2xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cc1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m2.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/hi1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cc2.8xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cg1.4xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/cr1.8xlarge",
      "Resource": "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/hs1.8xlarge"
    }
  ]
}'
# euare-useraddkey --as-account sjones -u sjones
XYUQIDI22K9OWD916SI6Y
OIYDLCaInPXOqhboQ1wMUqWBcHoTegvEA9ErVD1C
# euca-describe-instance-types -I XYUQIDI22K9OWD916SI6Y -S OIYDLCaInPXOqhboQ1wMUqWBcHoTegvEA9ErVD1C
INSTANCETYPE	Name       CPUs  Memory (MB)  Disk (GB)
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small      1          256          5
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro      1          256          5
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium     1          512         10
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium     2          512         10
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large      2          512         10
{code}
Thanks [~sjones] the policy addition you mentioned with wildcard describeinstance seems to have worked fine with user console not showing those 2 types i.e. m1.small and m1.large
[~hspencer], right (though the example has a syntax error in the trailing ",")

[~sjones], ah, ok, I was following the example in the [Admin Guide|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/admin-guide/access_polextens.html#access_polextens].  I applied an account quota on my 3.3.0 cloud using a _Resource_ list that way, and it worked fine.  In 3.3.1, will this result in a syntax error?  Just want to make sure which (or both) way works so we can update our documentation accordingly.  Thanks for the feedback here.
[~hspencer] I did not test your example. It would be better if our documentation used examples that are valid JSON (even if our parsing is lax)
[~sjones], agreed.  I will put in a DOC ticket to make sure that gets fixed.  Thanks.

Fix verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.3.1
Release     : 0.0.1425.el6

I had to use the wildcard "DescribeInstance*" for the policy when applied in the admin console because it complained "net.sf.json.JSONException: 'describeinstancetypes' does not match any defined action"

Fixed.

Installed Packages
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.880.20140415git1b9f1d5b.el6
Size        : 283 k
Repo        : installed
{noformat}
